linkedinDescription: Margie Jiang is a strategic and creative leader with a track record of building high-impact programs, cultivating executive and community relationships, and driving cross-functional initiatives from concept to execution. With a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration and Management from UC Berkeley's Haas School of Business, she combines strategic thinking with operational rigor to design scalable processes, manage complex stakeholder environments, and deliver memorable experiences for clients, partners, and communities. Margie is highly skilled at working closely with executive teams in fast-paced, ambiguous environments to translate ideas into business outcomes. In her current role at Deloitte, she designs and delivers impactful experiences that help C-suite executives solve complex strategic challenges. She also founded SF Social Club, a rapidly growing community organization, where she leads all business development, partnerships, marketing, and event planning, growing the community to over 400 members and more than 200 collaborators within its first two years. She also brings expertise from roles in influencer marketing, program development and management, and communications and public relations. Margie is passionate about creating meaningful relationships and strategic partnerships, collaborating with others to drive business growth and solve challenges through innovative strategies. In her free time, she loves taking and teaching dance classes, spending time with family and friends, traveling, and meeting new people in San Francisco and around the world.

linkedinHeadline: Independent User Researcher and UX Developer
linkedinDescription: I am a graduate of the University of California, Berkeley, having earned a bachelor's degree in Cognitive Science with a focus in Human Psychology and Sociology. I have also served as the Director of Video Games for the Business Careers in Entertainment Club (BCEC) at Berkeley. In my time in college, I have taken courses within the cognitive science department that have allowed me to learn interesting and varied topics such as human computer interaction, virtual communities and social media, human psychology, and language processing while additionally taking classes focused around game design and development.I am passionate about User Research and UX, with a significant interest in games as a service models (GaaS). As my interest would suggest, I look forward to a career conducting research primarily (but not exclusively) for game development. I feel that when it comes to video game design, research is a key aspect that can determine whether a game will be a success upon release. I know that through extensive testing and research studies, games will not only play smarter, but will offer an experience that aims to support the most important aspect of the industry, the player.I designate a portion of my spare time towards working on small independent projects that center around User Research and UX Design. I have completed the Google UX Design Professional Certificate wherein I learned the basics needed for starting a career in User Experience, as taught by UX professionals at Google. I also conduct research studies surrounding a variety of the games that I play in order to better understand how games are developed and why developers make the decisions that they do. I am particularly fond of looking at live games that implore the use of DLC and expansions in order to maintain longevity of their game, a model commonly known as "games as a service."During the times when I am not working on independent projects I like playing video games (some of my favorites include Super Metroid, Destiny 2, World of Warcraft, and almost every Sonic the Hedgehog game), cooking fantastic and creative meals, listening to informative podcasts, and spending time with my partner watching Kitchen Nightmares reruns.Please feel free to contact me at ianalejandrohunter@gmail.com or learn more on my personal portfolio: https://ianalejandrohunter.wixsite.com/my-site
